channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Disaster and insurance costs are rising. The middle class is struggling to hang on
item.description: Middle-class families are struggling to afford insurance in southwest Florida. Realtors say a wave of foreclosures could be coming.

item.title: She lost her purse — but strangers stepped in to save the day
item.description: On a trip to Chicago, Lavonne Schaafsma lost her purse. Two women saw a man rifling through it — and stepped in to help.

item.title: More women are renting dresses, coats and ugly sweaters as clothing prices tick up
item.description: More women are planning to deck the halls in rented fashion this year, just as inflation and tariffs are poised to push clothing prices higher.

item.title: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling schools. It wants underfunded districts to take them on
item.description: Rural school district superintendents are trying to find the best use of limited resources. Taking on the state's unmaintained buildings, they say, wi...

item.title: With 'Baby Botox,' young adults strive to keep wrinkles from ever forming
item.description: A growing number of 20-somethings are trying to freeze time with preventative Botox treatments. Here's what's behind the trend.

item.title: Moment Ex-Bangladesh leader Sheikh Hasina's sentence is announced
item.description: Hasina has called the court's decision "biased and politically motivated" in a statement released after the verdict.

item.title: 81 monkeys, meth found in car linked to wildlife smuggling network
item.description: A patrol stopped the vehicle and troops found 81 macaques stuffed into blue net bags.

item.title: Ousted Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death
item.description: Former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death over a deadly crackdown on anti-government protests last year.

item.title: Jets cornerback Kris Boyd critically injured in NYC shooting, reports say
item.description: Boyd was reportedly found shot in the abdomen in Midtown Manhattan and was rushed to the hospital.

item.title: Dozens of Indian pilgrims killed in bus accident in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Forty-five people were killed in the accident, while one survivor is in hospital, an Indian official said.

item.title: FAA lifts emergency order that slashed flights at 40 major U.S. airports
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration says it is lifting all restrictions on commercial flights that were imposed during the government shutdown.

item.title: South African man seen at neo-Nazi rally has Australian visa revoked
item.description: The civil engineer was seen in the front row of a protest organised by the National Socialist Network.

item.title: Communist and far-right candidates head to Chile presidential run-off
item.description: The Communist Party's Jeanette Jara will face far-right candidate José Antonio Kast in the second round of voting in December.

item.title: Sheikh Hasina: The pro-democracy icon who became an autocrat
item.description: Sheikh Hasina is credited for the country's economic progress but also accused of authoritarianism.

item.title: Declassified Amelia Earhart records include her last known communications
item.description: The documents include military reports about the search as well as memos, telegrams and newspaper clippings.

item.title: FAA lifts order slashing flights, allowing commercial airlines to resume their regular schedules
item.description: Summary: The Federal Aviation Administration says it is lifting all restrictions on commercial flights that were imposed during the government shutdow...

item.title: Immigrant student enrollment is dwindling at schools across the US
Dozens arrested in North Carolina immigration enforcement surge, Border Patrol official says
